meanings.definition: A mark or series of marks stamped on an article of gold, silver, or platinum by the maker as a guarantee of genuineness and purity.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler carefully examined the hallmarking on the ring to ensure its authenticity.
meanings.sent2: The hallmarking on the necklace indicated it was made of genuine silver.
meanings.sent3: The detective solved the case by following the trail of hallmarking left on the stolen bracelet.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and honesty were the hallmarking of her character, shining brightly in every action.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering hallmarking on the bracelet caught the sunlight, revealing its true value.

meanings.definition: The process of officially stamping a mark on an article of gold, silver, or platinum to indicate its genuineness and purity.
meanings.sent1: The hallmarking of the silver vase was done meticulously to ensure its quality.
meanings.sent2: During the inspection, the expert checked the hallmarking on each piece of jewelry.
meanings.sent3: The robot's job in the factory was to perform the hallmarking on the precious metals.
meanings.sent4: The team's dedication to perfection was evident in the precise hallmarking of each item.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the necklace was enhanced by the intricate hallmarking on the pendant.
